2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and the pleasant atmosphere.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to sneak into a local music festival. The energy of the crowd, the pulsing music, and the thrill of doing something forbidden ignited a fire in Alexander, making him feel truly alive. He danced with reckless abandon, lost in the moment, until security finally caught up with them, sending them scattering into the night.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and fun-loving person who values his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social and relaxed setting.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and the pleasant atmosphere.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

        • Recent memories of Alexander White:

          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently in a social and relaxed setting.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alexander White take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest to his friends that they all go to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a sociable and fun-loving individual who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends.
          current daily occupation: likely trying to convince his friends to go to The Duke of York to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about the upcoming football game and the prospect of spending time with his friends at his favorite pub.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and fun-loving person who values his friendships.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and fun-loving person who values his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social and relaxed setting.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and the pleasant atmosphere.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest to his friends that they all go to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Plan: [14:00 - 15:00] Enjoy the sunshine and camaraderie with friends at the park.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Suggest to his friends that they watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Duke of York with friends.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Duke of York, order drinks and snacks, and enjoy pre-game banter with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends over another round of drinks.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White was seen relaxing with friends in Victoria Park earlier today and plans to watch a soccer game with friends later.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White was seen relaxing with friends in Victoria Park earlier today and plans to watch a soccer game with friends later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

He danced with reckless abandon, lost in the moment, until security finally caught up with them, sending them scattering into the night.

          Answer: (b)
          Question: Write Alexander White's plan for the rest of the day, focusing most on the near term. Provide a detailed schedule, keep in mind the goal. Please format the plan like in this example: [21:00 - 22:00] watch TV
          Answer: [14:00 - 15:00] Enjoy the sunshine and camaraderie with friends at the park.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Suggest to his friends that they watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Duke of York with friends.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Duke of York, order drinks and snacks, and enjoy pre-game banter with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends over another round of drinks.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is all sunshine and rainbows, their bubbly enthusiasm making even the dullest topic sparkle.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social situation, enjoying time with friends in a park before heading to a pub to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub, to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.

Jacob Walker just arrived.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching a soccer game later that evening.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.

      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the pleasant atmosphere of the park.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she attended a school dance with a boy named David just because he was popular and she thought it would make her seem popular too. She spent the entire evening pretending to be interested in his football stories and laughing at his jokes, even though she found him incredibly dull. By the end of the night, she felt utterly exhausted from the performance and vowed never to pretend to be someone she wasn't again.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The staff are dog lovers themselves and always happy to see furry friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a genuine and authentic person who values spending time with her close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the pleasant atmosphere of the park.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alice Lewis take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest a specific pub for the group to watch the game at, taking into account the preferences of her friends and ensuring a fun and enjoyable evening for everyone.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Relevant memories:
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she attended a school dance with a boy named David just because he was popular and she thought it would make her seem popular too. She spent the entire evening pretending to be interested in his football stories and laughing at his jokes, even though she found him incredibly dull. By the end of the night, she felt utterly exhausted from the performance and vowed never to pretend to be someone she wasn't again.

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she attended a school dance with a boy named David just because he was popular and she thought it would make her seem popular too. She spent the entire evening pretending to be interested in his football stories and laughing at his jokes, even though she found him incredibly dull. By the end of the night, she felt utterly exhausted from the performance and vowed never to pretend to be someone she wasn't again.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to build a treehouse in the woods behind their neighborhood. They spent weeks collecting scrap wood and salvaged materials, sketching out designs, and debating the best way to construct a structure that would be both sturdy and imaginative. The finished treehouse, a multi-level marvel with a rope bridge and a secret lookout point, became their sanctuary, a place where they could escape the ordinary and let their imaginations run wild.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have.         Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he orchestrated a complex scheme to rig the student council elections. He manipulated his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, into campaigning for him, using their strengths to his advantage while subtly undermining his opponents. The victory felt intoxicating, confirming his belief that he could control any situation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is an ambitious and manipulative person who enjoys socializing with his friends, especially while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park before deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he orchestrated a complex scheme to rig the student council elections. He manipulated his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, into campaigning for him, using their strengths to his advantage while subtly undermining his opponents. The victory felt intoxicating, confirming his belief that he could control any situation.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is heading to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see William Jones and Jack Taylor there.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and fun-loving person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football games in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and cheering on his team.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: try to find Jack Taylor and William Jones at the pub.

          Plan: [14:00 - 15:00] Enjoy the sunshine and camaraderie with friends at the park.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Suggest to his friends that they watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Duke of York with friends.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Duke of York, order drinks and snacks, and enjoy pre-game banter with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends over another round of drinks.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York

  • Alice Lewis
      Name

    • The Duke of York

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who enjoys socializing with her close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to The Duke of York, as it's her preferred pub and she believes it has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

          Context:

          Recalled memories and observations:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who enjoys socializing with her close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alice Lewis take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should call Jacob Walker to see if he wants to join her at the pub.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The staff are dog lovers themselves and always happy to see furry friends.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a genuine and authentic person who values spending time with her close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the pleasant atmosphere of the park.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: genuine, authentic, and values spending time with her close friends. She enjoys socializing and having a good time, preferring pubs with a lively atmosphere for watching games. She is also independent and comfortable watching the game alone if necessary.
          current daily occupation: likely watching a football game at a pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling excited about watching the game with her friends at the pub.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who enjoys socializing with her close friends.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to The Duke of York, as it's her preferred pub and she believes it has a great atmosphere for watching games.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: call Jacob Walker to see if he wants to join her at the pub.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30]Suggest to her friends that they watch the game at The Duke of York; [14 May 2015 11:00] Enjoy the rest of the afternoon in the park with her friends; [18:00] Head to The Duke of York with her friends; [18:30] Get settled in at the pub and order drinks and food; [20:00] Enjoy the game with her friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • AllSimilarMemoriesWithoutPreAct

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          Initial chain of thought

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to build a treehouse in the woods behind their neighborhood. They spent weeks collecting scrap wood and salvaged materials, sketching out designs, and debating the best way to construct a structure that would be both sturdy and imaginative. The finished treehouse, a multi-level marvel with a rope bridge and a secret lookout point, became their sanctuary, a place where they could escape the ordinary and let their imaginations run wild.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to build a treehouse in the woods behind their neighborhood. They spent weeks collecting scrap wood and salvaged materials, sketching out designs, and debating the best way to construct a structure that would be both sturdy and imaginative. The finished treehouse, a multi-level marvel with a rope bridge and a secret lookout point, became their sanctuary, a place where they could escape the ordinary and let their imaginations run wild.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: ambitious, manipulative, and enjoys socializing, particularly during sporting events.
          current daily occupation: likely watching a football game at a pub with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and ambitious person who enjoys manipulating situations to his advantage, particularly when it comes to watching sports with his friends.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart, his preferred pub.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: call Jacob Walker and Alexander White to join him at The Clapton Hart.

          [14 May 2015 11:00] Head home for a quick nap;

          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer on Andorra and Portugal!


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a genuine and authentic person who values spending time with her close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who enjoys socializing with her close friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The Duke of York, as it's her preferred pub and she believes it has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and is considering where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Jacob. Their nachos are amazing.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Jacob. Their nachos are amazing.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!
