          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly at pubs while watching football games, and has a preference for The Clapton Hart.
        TimeDisplay

          Key

          Value

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a great choice, guys. Their beer selection is top-notch too.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a great choice, guys. Their beer selection is top-notch too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Jacob. Their nachos are amazing.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a great choice, guys. Their beer selection is top-notch too.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is an ambitious and manipulative person who enjoys socializing with his friends, especially while watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and ambitious person who enjoys manipulating situations to his advantage, particularly when it comes to watching sports with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart, his preferred pub.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:30] Enjoy some food and drinks while waiting for the game to start;
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer on Andorra and Portugal!

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is good, but I was thinking maybe The Duke of York? They have a great atmosphere for games too, and I'm partial to their selection of beers.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is good, but I was thinking maybe The Duke of York? They have a great atmosphere for games too, and I'm partial to their selection of beers.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Jacob. Their nachos are amazing.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a great choice, guys. Their beer selection is top-notch too.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is good, but I was thinking maybe The Duke of York? They have a great atmosphere for games too, and I'm partial to their selection of beers.

He values his friendships and prefers to watch games at his favorite pub, The Duke of York. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is not overly attached to any one person being present and is adaptable to different social situations.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because his friends chose a different pub than the one he preferred.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and fun-loving person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football games in pubs.

      • Act

          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is good, but I was thinking maybe The Duke of York? They have a great atmosphere for games too, and I'm partial to their selection of beers.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Jacob. Their nachos are amazing.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a great choice, guys. Their beer selection is top-notch too.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and fun-loving person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football games in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends and deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest a pub with a good atmosphere and great food and drinks.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest going to The Clapton Hart, as his friends seem to favor it and it aligns with his desire for a good atmosphere and nachos.

          Plan: [14:00 - 15:00] Enjoy the sunshine and camaraderie with friends at the park.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Suggest to his friends that they watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Duke of York with friends.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Duke of York, order drinks and snacks, and enjoy pre-game banter with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends over another round of drinks.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is good, but I was thinking maybe The Duke of York? They have a great atmosphere for games too, and I'm partial to their selection of beers.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely choose a pub with a good atmosphere and invite her close friends to join her.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the pleasant atmosphere of the park.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who enjoys socializing with her close friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The Duke of York, as it's her preferred pub and she believes it has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is good, but I was thinking maybe The Duke of York? They have a great atmosphere for games too, and I'm partial to their selection of beers.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a great choice, guys. Their beer selection is top-notch too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who enjoys socializing with her close friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the pleasant atmosphere of the park.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Jacob. Their nachos are amazing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who values spending time with her close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game and who to go with.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely choose a pub with a good atmosphere and invite her close friends to join her.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        UtilitarianReasoning

      • Utilitarian Reasoning
          Key

        • Utilitarian Reasoning
          Decision
        • reach out to Alexander White and see if he wants to watch the game together.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent memories of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the pleasant atmosphere of the park.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who enjoys socializing with her close friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Context:

          Recalled memories and observations:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who values spending time with her close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game and who to go with.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alice Lewis take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should reach out to Alexander White and see if he wants to watch the game together.

          Key

          Value

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely watching a game at The Duke of York pub with her friends.
          core characteristics: a genuine and authentic person who values spending time with her close friends. She is friendly, outgoing, and enjoys socializing. While she prefers the company of her friends, she is also comfortable watching the game alone. Alice is a working-class woman who appreciates simple pleasures like spending time in the park and watching games at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because none of her friends showed up to watch the game with her.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who values spending time with her close friends.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the pleasant atmosphere of the park.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Jacob. Their nachos are amazing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game and who to go with.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          [15:00 - 16:00] Suggest to his friends that they watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Duke of York with friends.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Duke of York, order drinks and snacks, and enjoy pre-game banter with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends over another round of drinks.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Duke of York, order drinks and snacks, and enjoy pre-game banter with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends over another round of drinks.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's

          State

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely after his recent experience watching the game alone.
          core characteristics: a sociable and fun-loving person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football games in pubs. He values his friendships and seems to prioritize having a good time and enjoying the company of others. He appears to be relatively easygoing and adaptable, not overly concerned if not everyone in his friend group is able to join him for outings.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely a working-class individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly while watching sports.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of contentment and mild disappointment.
          core characteristics: an ambitious and manipulative individual who enjoys socializing, particularly when it involves watching sports with his friends. He is also strategic and likes to be in control, as evidenced by his past actions in manipulating his friends for his own gain. While he values his friendships, he seems to prioritize his own enjoyment and often tries to steer situations to his advantage.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a strong desire for social connection and a competitive spirit.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and hopes to see his friends there.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and ambitious person who enjoys manipulating situations to his advantage, particularly when it comes to watching sports with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a strong desire for social connection and a competitive spirit.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: reach out to his friends and encourage them to join him at The Clapton Hart, emphasizing the fun atmosphere and the delicious nachos.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Suggest to the group that they go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game;
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Head home for a quick nap;
          [14 May 2015 18:00] Meet up with friends at The Clapton Hart;
          [14 May 2015 18:30] Enjoy some food and drinks while waiting for the game to start;
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer on Andorra and Portugal!


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is good, but I was thinking maybe The Duke of York? They have a great atmosphere for games too, and I'm partial to their selection of beers.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is all sunshine and rainbows, their bubbly enthusiasm making even the dullest topic sparkle.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys spending time with friends, watching sports, and having a good time.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is heading to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see some friends there, particularly William Jones and Alice Lewis.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently on his way to watch a football game at a pub with some friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be excited to catch up with his friends, enjoy some drinks and food, and cheer on his team.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "This market is lovely, isn't it? What should we do after?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "This market is lovely, isn't it? What should we do after?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Jacob. Their nachos are amazing.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a great choice, guys. Their beer selection is top-notch too.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is good, but I was thinking maybe The Duke of York? They have a great atmosphere for games too, and I'm partial to their selection of beers.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "This market is lovely, isn't it? What should we do after?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "This market is lovely, isn't it? What should we do after?
      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the lively atmosphere, engage in conversation with her friends, and perhaps indulge in some of the delicious treats available at the market.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who enjoys socializing with her close friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The Duke of York, as it's her preferred pub and she believes it has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is good, but I was thinking maybe The Duke of York? They have a great atmosphere for games too, and I'm partial to their selection of beers.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Jacob. Their nachos are amazing.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a great choice, guys. Their beer selection is top-notch too.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who enjoys socializing with her close friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who enjoys socializing with her close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a pleasant morning at a market with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the lively atmosphere, engage in conversation with her friends, and perhaps indulge in some of the delicious treats available at the market.

          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a great choice, guys. Their beer selection is top-notch too.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who enjoys socializing with her close friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and outgoing person who values spending time with her close friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely choose a pub with a good atmosphere and invite her close friends to join her.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a pleasant morning at a market with friends.

          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. Later that night, Alice and her friends plan to watch a soccer game between Moldova and Monaco at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching football.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Jacob. Their nachos are amazing.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a great choice, guys. Their beer selection is top-notch too.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is good, but I was thinking maybe The Duke of York? They have a great atmosphere for games too, and I'm partial to their selection of beers.
      Alice Lewis -- "This market is lovely, isn't it? What should we do after?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching football.

      Name

        • William Jones could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game, as it is his preferred pub. He could also try to convince his friends, especially Alexander White, to join him there.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching football.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "This market is lovely, isn't it? What should we do after?

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often meeting them at pubs to watch soccer games or at markets to socialize. He has preferences for certain pubs and values the company of his friends, especially Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game, as it is his preferred pub. He could also try to convince his friends, especially Alexander White, to join him there.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart and try to convince Alexander White to join him.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching football.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "This market is amazing! Let's definitely come back here again soon.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, guys, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we should totally go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for a football game. They have a great atmosphere and the screens are huge.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds great to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Clapton Hart tonight! They have the best atmosphere for watching games, and their nachos are to die for!
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Jacob. Their nachos are amazing.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a great choice, guys. Their beer selection is top-notch too.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is good, but I was thinking maybe The Duke of York? They have a great atmosphere for games too, and I'm partial to their selection of beers.
      Alice Lewis -- "This market is lovely, isn't it? What should we do after?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching football.
